intro: Crinum × gowenianum, commonly known as the hybrid crinum, is a striking bulbous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, strap-like leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pink flowers with a prominent central spike, often blooming in summer. Its bulbs are large and can be propagated through division or seed. Crinum × gowenianum is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
